ExecutableTestSuite.label: Conformance class: Application schema, Population Distribution
ExecutableTestSuite.description:
This test suite examines requirements associated with the application schema.

This is a draft version. It has limitations and is expected to contain errors. Please report any issues or problems in GitHub.

Known limitations are documented in the description of the applicable test case or test assertion. There is a general limitation in all assertions that extensions in additional application schemas are only supported, if the unqualified name of the feature type in the extension is the same as the name of the feature type in the INSPIRE application schema.

Source: Conformance Class 'Application Schema, Population Distribution'

Pre-requisite conformance classes:
  • Conformance Class 'GML application schemas, Population Distribution'
ExecutableTestSuite.author: Consortium Bilbomatica, Guadaltel y Geograma

ParameterList.name: ETF Standard Parameters for XML test objects

TestCase.label: Code list values
TestCase.description: Verify whether all attributes whose value type is a code list take the values set out therein.

TestAssertion.label: pd-as.a.1: type
TestAssertion.description:
Check that all the type elements has a xlink:href attribute pointing to a pre-defined value. If the check fails a manual check will be required asking to review the code list definition in order to verify that any extensions do not overlap with the code lists that are defined in Annexes II, III and IV of the Implementing Rule. If the check fails report reviewCodeListValue.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (1): For the exchange and classification of spatial objects from data sets meeting the conditions laid down in Article 4 of Directive 2007/2/EC, Member States shall use the spatial object types and associated data types, enumerations and code lists that are defined in Annexes II, III and IV for the themes the data sets relate to.
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (3): The enumerations and code lists used in attributes or association roles of spatial object types or data types shall comply with the definitions and include the values set out in Annex II. The enumeration and code list values are uniquely identified by language-neutral mnemonic codes for computers. The values may also include a language-specific name to be used for human interaction.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (1): Code lists shall be of one of the following types, as specified in the Annexes:
    1. code lists whose allowed values comprise only the values specifiedin this Regulation;
    2. code lists whose allowed values comprise the values specified in this Regulation and narrower values defined by data providers;
    3. code lists whose allowed values comprise the values specified in this Regulation and additional values at any level defined by data providers;
    4. code lists, whose allowed values comprise any values defined by data providers.
    For the purposes of points (b), (c) and (d), in addition to the allowed values, data providers may use the values specified inthe relevant INSPIRE Technical Guidance document available on the INSPIRE web site of the Joint Research Centre.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (2): Code lists may be hierarchical. Values of hierarchical code lists may have a more generic parent value. Where the valid values of a hierarchical code list are specified in a table in this Regulation, the parent values are listed in the last column.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (3): Where, for anattribute whose type is a code list as referred to in points (b), (c) or (d) of paragraph 1, a data provider provides a value that is not specified in this Regulation, that value and its definition shall be made available in a register
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (4): Attributes or association roles of spatial object types or data types whose type is a code list may only take values that are allowed according to the specification of the code list.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Code list values', INSPIRE Data Specification on Population Distribution, A.4.2, (A.5.3.6.1)
TestAssertion.expression:
let $codelist := 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/ClassificationItemTypeValue' let $codelisturl := 'https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/ClassificationItemTypeValue/ClassificationItemTypeValue.en.xml' let $valid_href := fn:doc($codelisturl)/*:codelist/*:containeditems/*:codelist/@id let $property_string := 'ClassificationItemTypeValue' let $features_selected := $features[self::pd:StatisticalDistribution] let $messages1 := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/pd:value/pd:StatisticalValue/pd:dimensions/pd:Dimensions/pd:thematic/pd:ClassificationItem for $ClassificationItem in $envDom let $list := $features_selected/pd:value/pd:StatisticalValue/pd:dimensions/pd:Dimensions/pd:thematic/pd:ClassificationItem/pd:type/@xlink:href let $iterlist:= for $elem in $list return if ($elem = $ClassificationItem/pd:type/@xlink:href) then $elem else () return if(count($ClassificationItem/pd:type) = 0) then local:addMessage('TR.missingElement', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': 'pd:type'}) else if (count($ClassificationItem/pd:type) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicity', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'element': 'pd:type', 'multiplicity': '1', 'count':count($ClassificationItem/pd:type)}) else if(not(exists($ClassificationItem/pd:type/@xlink:href))) then local:addMessage('TR.missingAttribute', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'attribute': 'xlink:href'}) else if(not($ClassificationItem/pd:type/@xlink:href = $valid_href)) then local:addMessage('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string($ClassificationItem/pd:type/@xlink:href), 'count': count($iterlist)-1}) else ()
let $messages2 := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/pd:classification/pd:Classification/pd:item/pd:ClassificationItem for $ClassificationItem in $envDom let $list := $features_selected/pd:classification/pd:Classification/pd:item/pd:ClassificationItem/pd:type/@xlink:href let $iterlist:= for $elem in $list return if ($elem = $ClassificationItem/pd:type/@xlink:href) then $elem else () return if(count($ClassificationItem/pd:type) = 0) then local:addMessage('TR.missingElement', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': 'pd:type'}) else if (count($ClassificationItem/pd:type) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicity', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'element': 'pd:type', 'multiplicity':'1', 'count':count($ClassificationItem/pd:type)}) else if(not(exists($ClassificationItem/pd:type/@xlink:href))) then local:addMessage('TR.missingAttribute', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'attribute': 'xlink:href'}) else if(not($ClassificationItem/pd:type/@xlink:href = $valid_href)) then local:addMessage('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string($ClassificationItem/pd:type/@xlink:href), 'count': count($iterlist)-1}) else ()
let $combined_messages := ($messages1, $messages2) return (if ($combined_messages and not($combined_messages/@ref = ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue'))) then 'FAILED' else if($combined_messages/@ref = ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue') and not($combined_messages/@ref != ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue'))) then 'PASSED_MANUAL' else if($combined_messages and $combined_messages/@ref != ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue')) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($combined_messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $combined_messages)

TestAssertion.label: pd-as.a.2: measurementMethod
TestAssertion.description:
Check that all the measurementMethod elements has a xlink:href attribute pointing to a pre-defined value. If the check fails a manual check will be required asking to review the code list definition in order to verify that any extensions do not overlap with the code lists that are defined in Annexes II, III and IV of the Implementing Rule. If the check fails report reviewCodeListValue.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (1): For the exchange and classification of spatial objects from data sets meeting the conditions laid down in Article 4 of Directive 2007/2/EC, Member States shall use the spatial object types and associated data types, enumerations and code lists that are defined in Annexes II, III and IV for the themes the data sets relate to.
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (3): The enumerations and code lists used in attributes or association roles of spatial object types or data types shall comply with the definitions and include the values set out in Annex II. The enumeration and code list values are uniquely identified by language-neutral mnemonic codes for computers. The values may also include a language-specific name to be used for human interaction.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (1): Code lists shall be of one of the following types, as specified in the Annexes:
    1. code lists whose allowed values comprise only the values specifiedin this Regulation;
    2. code lists whose allowed values comprise the values specified in this Regulation and narrower values defined by data providers;
    3. code lists whose allowed values comprise the values specified in this Regulation and additional values at any level defined by data providers;
    4. code lists, whose allowed values comprise any values defined by data providers.
    For the purposes of points (b), (c) and (d), in addition to the allowed values, data providers may use the values specified inthe relevant INSPIRE Technical Guidance document available on the INSPIRE web site of the Joint Research Centre.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (2): Code lists may be hierarchical. Values of hierarchical code lists may have a more generic parent value. Where the valid values of a hierarchical code list are specified in a table in this Regulation, the parent values are listed in the last column.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (3): Where, for anattribute whose type is a code list as referred to in points (b), (c) or (d) of paragraph 1, a data provider provides a value that is not specified in this Regulation, that value and its definition shall be made available in a register
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (4): Attributes or association roles of spatial object types or data types whose type is a code list may only take values that are allowed according to the specification of the code list.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Code list values', INSPIRE Data Specification on Population Distribution, A.4.2, (A.5.3.6.1)
TestAssertion.expression: let $codelist := 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/StatisticsMeasurementMethodValue' let $codelisturl := 'https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/StatisticsMeasurementMethodValue/StatisticsMeasurementMethodValue.en.xml' let $valid_href := fn:doc($codelisturl)/*:codelist/*:containeditems/*:value/@id let $property_string := 'StatisticsMeasurementMethodValue' let $features_selected := $features[self::pd:StatisticalDistribution] let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/pd:measurementMethod let $list := $features_selected/pd:measurementMethod/@xlink:href let $iterlist:= for $elem in $list return if ($elem = $envDom/@xlink:href) then $elem else () return if(count($envDom) = 0) then local:addMessage('TR.missingElement', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': 'pd:measurementMethod'}) else if (count($envDom) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicity', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'element': 'pd:measurementMethod', 'multiplicity': '1', 'count':count($envDom)}) else if(not(exists($envDom/@xlink:href))) then local:addMessage('TR.missingAttribute', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'attribute': 'xlink:href'}) else if(not($envDom/@xlink:href = $valid_href)) then local:addMessage('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string($envDom/@xlink:href), 'count': count($iterlist) - 1}) else () return (if ($messages and not($messages/@ref = ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue'))) then 'FAILED' else if($messages/@ref = ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue') and not($messages/@ref != ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue'))) then 'PASSED_MANUAL' else if($messages and $messages/@ref != ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue')) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.description:
Check that all the generalStatus elements has a xlink:href attribute pointing to a pre-defined value. If the check fails a manual check will be required asking to review the code list definition in order to verify that any extensions do not overlap with the code lists that are defined in Annexes II, III and IV of the Implementing Rule. If the check fails report reviewCodeListValue.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (1): For the exchange and classification of spatial objects from data sets meeting the conditions laid down in Article 4 of Directive 2007/2/EC, Member States shall use the spatial object types and associated data types, enumerations and code lists that are defined in Annexes II, III and IV for the themes the data sets relate to.
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (3): The enumerations and code lists used in attributes or association roles of spatial object types or data types shall comply with the definitions and include the values set out in Annex II. The enumeration and code list values are uniquely identified by language-neutral mnemonic codes for computers. The values may also include a language-specific name to be used for human interaction.

TestAssertion.expression: let $codelist := 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/StatisticalDataStatusValue' let $codelisturl := 'https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/StatisticalDataStatusValue/StatisticalDataStatusValue.en.xml' let $valid_href := fn:doc($codelisturl)/*:codelist/*:containeditems/*:value/@id let $property_string := 'StatisticalDataStatusValue' let $features_selected := $features[self::pd:StatisticalDistribution] let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/pd:generalStatus let $list := $features_selected/pd:generalStatus/@xlink:href let $iterlist:= for $elem in $list return if ($elem = $envDom/@xlink:href) then $elem else () return if(count($envDom) = 0) then local:addMessage('TR.missingElement', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': 'pd:generalStatus'}) else if (count($envDom) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicity', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'element': 'pd:generalStatus', 'multiplicity': '1', 'count':count($envDom)}) else if(not(exists($envDom/@xlink:href))) then local:addMessage('TR.missingAttribute', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'attribute': 'xlink:href'}) else if(not($envDom/@xlink:href = $valid_href)) then local:addMessage('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string($envDom/@xlink:href), 'count': count($iterlist)-1}) else () return (if ($messages and not($messages/@ref = ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue'))) then 'FAILED' else if($messages/@ref = ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue') and not($messages/@ref != ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue'))) then 'PASSED_MANUAL' else if($messages and $messages/@ref != ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue')) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.label: pd-as.a.4: status
TestAssertion.description:
Check that all the status elements has a xlink:href attribute pointing to a pre-defined value. If the check fails a manual check will be required asking to review the code list definition in order to verify that any extensions do not overlap with the code lists that are defined in Annexes II, III and IV of the Implementing Rule. If the check fails report reviewCodeListValue.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (1): For the exchange and classification of spatial objects from data sets meeting the conditions laid down in Article 4 of Directive 2007/2/EC, Member States shall use the spatial object types and associated data types, enumerations and code lists that are defined in Annexes II, III and IV for the themes the data sets relate to.
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (3): The enumerations and code lists used in attributes or association roles of spatial object types or data types shall comply with the definitions and include the values set out in Annex II. The enumeration and code list values are uniquely identified by language-neutral mnemonic codes for computers. The values may also include a language-specific name to be used for human interaction.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (1): Code lists shall be of one of the following types, as specified in the Annexes:
    1. code lists whose allowed values comprise only the values specifiedin this Regulation;
    2. code lists whose allowed values comprise the values specified in this Regulation and narrower values defined by data providers;
    3. code lists whose allowed values comprise the values specified in this Regulation and additional values at any level defined by data providers;
    4. code lists, whose allowed values comprise any values defined by data providers.
    For the purposes of points (b), (c) and (d), in addition to the allowed values, data providers may use the values specified inthe relevant INSPIRE Technical Guidance document available on the INSPIRE web site of the Joint Research Centre.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (2): Code lists may be hierarchical. Values of hierarchical code lists may have a more generic parent value. Where the valid values of a hierarchical code list are specified in a table in this Regulation, the parent values are listed in the last column.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (3): Where, for anattribute whose type is a code list as referred to in points (b), (c) or (d) of paragraph 1, a data provider provides a value that is not specified in this Regulation, that value and its definition shall be made available in a register
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (4): Attributes or association roles of spatial object types or data types whose type is a code list may only take values that are allowed according to the specification of the code list.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Code list values', INSPIRE Data Specification on Population Distribution, A.4.2, (A.5.3.6.1)
TestAssertion.expression:
let $codelist := 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/StatisticalDataStatusValue' let $codelisturl := 'https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/StatisticalDataStatusValue/StatisticalDataStatusValue.en.xml' let $valid_href := fn:doc($codelisturl)/*:codelist/*:containeditems/*:value/@id let $property_string := 'StatisticalDataStatusValue' let $features_selected := $features[self::pd:StatisticalDistribution] let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/pd:value/pd:StatisticalValue let $list := $features_selected/pd:value/pd:StatisticalValue/pd:status/@xlink:href let $iterlist:= for $elem in $list return if ($elem = $envDom/pd:status/@xlink:href) then $elem else () for $statisticalValue in $envDom return if(count($statisticalValue/pd:status) = 0) then local:addMessage('TR.missingElement', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': 'pd:status'}) else if (count($statisticalValue/pd:status) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicity', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'element': 'pd:status', 'multiplicity': '1', 'count':count($statisticalValue/pd:status)}) else if(not(exists($statisticalValue/pd:status/@xlink:href))) then local:addMessage('TR.missingAttribute', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'attribute': 'xlink:href'}) else if (not($statisticalValue/pd:status/@xlink:href = $valid_href)) then local:addMessage('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string($statisticalValue/pd:status/@xlink:href), 'count': count($iterlist)-1}) else ()
return (if ($messages and not($messages/@ref = ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue'))) then 'FAILED' else if($messages/@ref = ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue') and not($messages/@ref != ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue'))) then 'PASSED_MANUAL' else if($messages and $messages/@ref != ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue')) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.label: pd-as.a.5: specialValue
TestAssertion.description:
Check that all the specialValue elements has a xlink:href attribute pointing to a pre-defined value. If the check fails a manual check will be required asking to review the code list definition in order to verify that any extensions do not overlap with the code lists that are defined in Annexes II, III and IV of the Implementing Rule. If the check fails report reviewCodeListValue.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (1): For the exchange and classification of spatial objects from data sets meeting the conditions laid down in Article 4 of Directive 2007/2/EC, Member States shall use the spatial object types and associated data types, enumerations and code lists that are defined in Annexes II, III and IV for the themes the data sets relate to.
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (3): The enumerations and code lists used in attributes or association roles of spatial object types or data types shall comply with the definitions and include the values set out in Annex II. The enumeration and code list values are uniquely identified by language-neutral mnemonic codes for computers. The values may also include a language-specific name to be used for human interaction.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (1): Code lists shall be of one of the following types, as specified in the Annexes:
    1. code lists whose allowed values comprise only the values specifiedin this Regulation;
    2. code lists whose allowed values comprise the values specified in this Regulation and narrower values defined by data providers;
    3. code lists whose allowed values comprise the values specified in this Regulation and additional values at any level defined by data providers;
    4. code lists, whose allowed values comprise any values defined by data providers.
    For the purposes of points (b), (c) and (d), in addition to the allowed values, data providers may use the values specified inthe relevant INSPIRE Technical Guidance document available on the INSPIRE web site of the Joint Research Centre.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (2): Code lists may be hierarchical. Values of hierarchical code lists may have a more generic parent value. Where the valid values of a hierarchical code list are specified in a table in this Regulation, the parent values are listed in the last column.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (3): Where, for anattribute whose type is a code list as referred to in points (b), (c) or (d) of paragraph 1, a data provider provides a value that is not specified in this Regulation, that value and its definition shall be made available in a register
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (4): Attributes or association roles of spatial object types or data types whose type is a code list may only take values that are allowed according to the specification of the code list.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Code list values', INSPIRE Data Specification on Population Distribution, A.4.2, (A.5.3.6.1)
TestAssertion.expression:
let $codelist := 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/SpecialValue' let $codelisturl := 'https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/SpecialValue/SpecialValue.en.xml' let $valid_href := fn:doc($codelisturl)/*:codelist/*:containeditems/*:value/@id let $property_string := 'SpecialValue' let $features_selected := $features[self::pd:StatisticalDistribution] let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $list := $features_selected/pd:value/pd:StatisticalValue/pd:specialValue/@xlink:href let $envDom := $feature/pd:value/pd:StatisticalValue let $iterlist:= for $elem in $list return if ($elem = $envDom/pd:specialValue/@xlink:href) then $elem else () for $statisticalValue in $envDom return if (count($statisticalValue/pd:specialValue) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicity', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'element': 'pd:specialValue', 'multiplicity': '0 or 1', 'count':count($statisticalValue/pd:specialValue)}) else if(exists($statisticalValue/pd:specialValue) and not(exists($statisticalValue/pd:specialValue/@xlink:href))) then local:addMessage('TR.missingAttribute', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'attribute': 'xlink:href'}) else if (exists($statisticalValue/pd:specialValue) and not($statisticalValue/pd:specialValue/@xlink:href = $valid_href)) then local:addMessage('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string($statisticalValue/pd:specialValue/@xlink:href), 'count': count($iterlist) - 1}) else ()
return (if ($messages and not($messages/@ref = ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue'))) then 'FAILED' else if($messages/@ref = ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue') and not($messages/@ref != ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue'))) then 'PASSED_MANUAL' else if($messages and $messages/@ref != ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue')) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestCase.label: Constraints
TestCase.description: Verify that the features provided in the dataset adhere to the constraints specified in the INSPIRE application schema.

TestAssertion.label: pd-as.b.1: type
TestAssertion.description:
Check that either the value or the specialValue attribute is provided.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Constraints', INSPIRE Data Specification on Population Distribution, A.1.6
TestAssertion.expression:
let $features_selected := $features[self::pd:StatisticalDistribution] let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/pd:value/pd:StatisticalValue for $StatisticalValue in $envDom return if(not(exists($StatisticalValue/pd:specialValue)) and not(exists($StatisticalValue/pd:value))) then local:addMessage('TR.constraintViolation', map { 'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType': local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@gml:id), 'constraint': 'Either the value or the specialValue attribute is provided', 'additionalInfo': '' }) else if (count($StatisticalValue/pd:specialValue) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicity', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'element': 'pd:specialValue', 'multiplicity': '0 or 1', 'count':count($StatisticalValue/pd:specialValue)}) else if (count($StatisticalValue/pd:value) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicity', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'element': 'pd:value', 'multiplicity': '0 or 1', 'count':count($StatisticalValue/pd:value)}) else ()
return (if ($messages and not($messages/@ref = ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue'))) then 'FAILED' else if($messages/@ref = ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue') and not($messages/@ref != ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue'))) then 'PASSED_MANUAL' else if($messages and $messages/@ref != ('TR.manual.reviewCodeListValue')) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)
